Posted By: Cyberium (9/26/2012 1:50:15 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A design home run IMO. It will feel really good flashing this in to kill the front and back of [Lingering Souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lingering Souls) in one fell swoop. Not in fully serious constructed OFC, but great casual card.  
  
The 0/3 is probably quite carefully calculated - this pinger simply cannot hurt opponents without help, but is more solid against creatures than pretty much any Tim printed yet.  
  
Also, Selesnya players will wish they took the time to name their newly populated tokens. Seriously, how degrading must life as a token be when your name is always the same as your siblings or, now, parents?
posts.html:
A design home run IMO. It will feel really good flashing this in to kill the front and back of Lingering Souls in one fell swoop. Not in fully serious constructed OFC, but great casual card.

The 0/3 is probably quite carefully calculated - this pinger simply cannot hurt opponents without help, but is more solid against creatures than pretty much any Tim printed yet.

Also, Selesnya players will wish they took the time to name their newly populated tokens. Seriously, how degrading must life as a token be when your name is always the same as your siblings or, now, parents?

Posted By: djflo (9/26/2012 9:18:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Not sure being multicolor and uncommon should have been grounds to make her what is arguably the best hasty 3-mana pinger Wizards has ever printed... The 0/3 body is already better than what either [Cunning Sparkmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cunning Sparkmage) or [Vulshok Sorcerer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vulshok Sorcerer) get. I agree that the trickier casting cost does merit a few perks, but a sturdy frame, flash, and the "hit each creature with the same name as target creature" seems a tad over the top. I would have been fine with maybe two out of the three. That said, she's amazing, I love her, and I look forward to nuking fields worth of spirit/human tokens, as well as [Arbor Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arbor Elf) and [Llanowar Elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elves) soon.
posts.html:
Not sure being multicolor and uncommon should have been grounds to make her what is arguably the best hasty 3-mana pinger Wizards has ever printed... The 0/3 body is already better than what either Cunning Sparkmage or Vulshok Sorcerer get. I agree that the trickier casting cost does merit a few perks, but a sturdy frame, flash, and the "hit each creature with the same name as target creature" seems a tad over the top. I would have been fine with maybe two out of the three. That said, she's amazing, I love her, and I look forward to nuking fields worth of spirit/human tokens, as well as Arbor Elf and Llanowar Elves soon.

Works well in an Izzet-EDH with [Mind over Matter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind over Matter).  
  
Tap  
Discard  
Tap

On the other hand, if you can pull this off you are propably winning anyway.

Posted By: Weisse (10/7/2012 6:46:24 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I feel like there has to be some kind of combo for this card. In Innistrad we saw a lot of "tiddle" cards.  
  
Per example:  
[Captain of the Mists](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Captain of the Mists)  
[Galvanic Alchemist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Galvanic Alchemist)  
[Ghostly Touch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghostly Touch)  
[Niblis of the Breath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Niblis of the Breath)  
  
Otherwise the obvious connections to cards like this are usually [Basilisk Collar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Basilisk Collar). In Standard you could always do [Nightshade Peddler](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nightshade Peddler) and [Butcher's Cleaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Butcher's Cleaver) or [Vault of the Archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vault of the Archangel). In reality Butcher's Cleaver isn't a bad option on her. It makes her a 3/3 so she can attack on an empty board and the cleaver lets her pick up anywhere between 1-4+ life in a pinch.
posts.html:
I feel like there has to be some kind of combo for this card. In Innistrad we saw a lot of "tiddle" cards.

Per example:
Captain of the Mists
Galvanic Alchemist
Ghostly Touch
Niblis of the Breath

Otherwise the obvious connections to cards like this are usually Basilisk Collar. In Standard you could always do Nightshade Peddler and Butcher's Cleaver or Vault of the Archangel. In reality Butcher's Cleaver isn't a bad option on her. It makes her a 3/3 so she can attack on an empty board and the cleaver lets her pick up anywhere between 1-4+ life in a pinch.
